job_title: Adjunct Faculty Instructor in Perrysburg, OH
pros: As a part-time instructor, I felt valued and not stressed over the work.
cons: It can be slow at times.

review_title: Don't get paid much but good flexablity
pros: They give a decent amount of sick and vaction time. Depending on yoru boss you ca also flex your time. I get a lot of autonomy and if it is not a stressfull job. I do not work outside of my work hours.
cons: Paid is low and benfits have been declning. Required to be in the office 40 hours a week. Not able to work from home at all as secretary. There are a lot of emplyees who have been there for a long time and many for a super short time but few who have been there between 5 and 15 years. Turn over is high. A lot of mind set around "this is how it has always been done." Little to no room for advancement.

pros: Benefits are excellent. Health, dental, vision and very generous PTO
cons: Almost no raises in 19 years. Salary is very low

pros: You go in and teach your class then leave.
cons: Downsized the number of chairmen and they are overworked so communication has taken a hit

pros: I liked some of my coworkers.
cons: Don't work here. I'm seeing a lot of reviews stating there is favoritism and abusive leadership. This couldn't be more true. I left after a very short time. I have PTSD from a previous toxic agency I was at for 10 years and refuse to allow myself to be treated that way again. Administrators make assumptions and participate in gossip. If you correct inaccuracies or stand up for yourself, you will be treated even worse. Then they act like turnover is high because UT and BGSU "steal" all their employees. No. You're just an abusive leader.

review_title: Owens Community College Culinary Arts Department
pros: Smaller student-teacher ratios allow for more individualized and personable assistance and advice. The instructors are invested in both the students success and future plans and goals; legitimate care and concern for developing skills and knowledge.
cons: Due to lower enrollments, some classes have been canceled or their content altered to the point that some information is omitted or dependent upon student research/reading. This may lead to extended timelines to graduation.

pros: The pay was nice and benefits were okay. Co workers were nice.
cons: You are not allowed to be sick, they will fire you and the teachers union will not help you.

review_title: Owens is very student focused and a great place to work
pros: Great co-workers and supportive boss
cons: Students who make excuses about why they aren't getting good grades.

pros: Much academic freedom as a professor
cons: Too much administrative turnover - seems to be a minor league "feeder" to local 4-year institutions

pros: Great benefits and good administration
cons: Turnover due to lower salaries

pros: Flexible hours, nice people, learning opportunities
cons: pay is minimum wage, only part-time and no benefits

pros: Working at Owens feels like  becoming part of an academic family.  I have forged lifelong friendships in only 2 years.  My supervisor not only did her job, but also became a trusted friend.  Compensation for my non-tenured position was quite high for this area of Ohio. Owens encouraged a very strong bond between educators and students by constantly facilitating fun, engaging social events on campus. What job lets you make snow cones for students and then challenge those sane students to a ride on a mechanical bull?
cons: The biggest issues I faced at Owens was a lack of concern by upper management for doing the most important work of maintaining accreditation for its nursing program-a major revenue source for the college. This impacted all other programs as well due to budget cuts, decreased class sizes, etc. Highly qualified and effective individuals were let go along with the irresponsible upper management in the nursing programs.

job_title: Software Engineer in New York, NY
pros: Good coworkers feel like family.
cons: Help desk position has not much work to do.

review_title: Great Place to Work While in School
pros: Flexible hours, great people to work with.
cons: I enjoyed working with Owens, no cons.

pros: Great students and staff to work with
cons: Leadership is chaotic most of the time and one individual often pretends she is an expert in fields she is not on the student services side. She creates a lot of division and seems to take pride in doing so.

review_title: Owens is a starting point, not a destination
pros:
Professional development opportunities (you'll have to be proactive and find them yourself).
You'll get great teaching experiences (in terms of variety of classes and different class formats).
You'll get to work with a diverse group of students.
My experiences at Owens have been extremely helpful in attaining a full-time faculty position elsewhere.
cons:
Pay is not that great (it's pretty much the standard pay for adjunct faculty).
With the exception of STRS (State Teacher Retirement System), no benefits (there again, it goes with being part-time).
Opportunities and recognition can be limited (i.e., adjuncts will not get the same opportunities or recognition that full-time faculty receive).
No guarantee for classes (despite good performance and effort).  
Turnover in administration. Anytime your supervisor leaves, it seems like your track record is forgotten and you have to prove yourself (again).
At one point in time, getting a lot of hours was easy for an adjunct faculty member. Now, you're lucky if you get one class or two classes for a semester. 
Communication could be better. It is disheartening to hear full-time faculty complain about adjuncts not doing certain things when no one told us that we needed to complete those tasks.

review_title: Great people, Breat Edcuation, Great Community Atmosphere
pros: Instructors are given a lot of freedom as long as you design your teaching approach around their basic curriculum, you should be fairly successful. All staff  & faculty members are extremely friendly and helpful if you have issues with anything, so asking questions to anyone who is employed there would be advantageous.
cons: Not many Cons about Owens CC, just making sure you do your duties as an Instructor or else your class will be out of your control. It's basically based on your dedication to your position -  if you do not communicate, then there may be issues, yet as long as you communicate efficiently with your supervisor and co-workers, then everything should be smoothly operating.

review_title: Great place to start a Higher Ed career
pros: Good work/life balance, many employees who truly care for their students. Caseloads for advisors are manageable and their programs actually lead to jobs! Benefits are fantastic, but this is true of most state higher ed.
cons: Poor salaries compared to even other institutions in the area, recent financial trouble has led to downsizing that has hurt their enrollment

review_title: Was a decent place to work, not fiscally responsible
pros: some nice colleagues, flexible schedule
cons: turnover in administration, too many personal agendas/politics, financial challenges, reduction in force not handled consistently.  Stressful environment, low morale.

review_title: Human Resources Dept is a great team of people.
job_title: Human Resources Manager in Toledo, OH
pros: The students here really want to improve their lives. They are a diverse group of people and mostly a joy to work with. The culture at Owens is warm and family friendly. Flexibility is encouraged in the departments. Owens actually values the time you spend with your family. They walk the talk unlike some other companies.
cons: Like most Colleges enrollment is down. This makes a challenging environment.

job_title: Computer Lab Staff in Toledo, OH
pros: nice people and very nice boss. Student are very respectable and nice. I enjoy helping people whenever i can and my hours are very flexible.
cons: none. there are no problems with working in the computer lab. I am taking courses and it is very helpful to have access to the internet.

job_title: Professional Tutor in Bowling Green, OH
pros: A great place to work. My coworkers (other tutors, adjuncts, etc) were super friendly, and nice to have around during the (frequent) downtime. I liked being able to do my own homework during slower days. Really good pay for the work.
cons: Hours are capped at 24 for tutors, but the pay combined with being a student makes it very much worth the compromise.

pros: good sense of camaraderie, good time off accumulation, free and easy parking, flexible hours in the summer, free gym, good lunch time and length
cons: micromanaging supervisor, not all weekends off, small gym, little to do when classes are not in session, students tend to be immature

pros: There are none.   The place is a fiscally irresponsible mess
cons: Too many to count.  No raises. Abuse of powers. Discrimination and civil rights abuse.  No money at the school in their budget. Nepotism.  Favoritism.  They only keep the employees that agree with ignorant management those that speak up or outshine their master is immediately fired

pros: Flexible schedule, great students and faculty. Good parking and safe environment to work in! Some benefits are good.  Upper management is not observed on campus often
cons: Hour fluctuations. You cannot count on a specific pay amount because it changes so often. You have long breaks between semesters with no pay.

pros: Well compensated for the requirements.  Direct supervisor is prompt in responding to situations that arise.
cons: Part time position limits the opportunity for compensation, but the flexibility more than makes up for it

review_title: It was great! I enjoyed by job being a student-employee.
job_title: Administrative Assistant Student/Employee in Findlay, OH
pros: It is very fun to work with such a variety of students.
cons: Some students take out their issues with tuition costs, inability to pay, etc. on the front desk administration staff who have nothing to do with their problems.

pros: I worked as a student worker, and I loved the fact that I was included in various office functions, and was treated like a regular employee.
cons: Students only make minimum wage.

review_title: Great co-workers, great work environment, but low pay.
pros: Great benefits.  Fantastic group of co-workers.  Work atmosphere not as high-pressure and my previous "private industry" job.
cons: Low pay.  Union workers get guaranteed raises.  Non-union workers raises are non-existent.   Promotions are very few and far between.

pros: This Job was very rewarding and challenging.  Helping adults successfully complete the newest version of the General Education Diploma test.  Approximately 50% of students were able to complete successfully.
cons: Classes had mixed levels of education, making it difficult to stay on track.

pros: Peer workers are great and do an amazing job.
cons: Management and policies are often unclear and are implemented with out any real direction.  No loyalty to part-time/adjunct staff.

review_title: My volleyball team won the NJCAA DIII Volleyball National Championship.
pros: I enjoy working with my staff and the student-athletes.
cons: I have had two Presidents, two CFO's and two Supervisors in my four years.  My budget gets slashed 15% each year.

pros: I was able to learn how to deal with people of all different types of IT background
cons: Monotonous, no room for improvement or advancement unless you stay there a while.

pros: Great healthcare benefits, pretty good coworkers
cons: Unclear expectations from management; was constantly mircomanaged

review_title: Great, meet lots of new people, friendly enviroment

pros: good people to work with
